title: What can i do to stop the wage garnishment? I never sign anything to CACH,LLC.
question: Received a wage garnishment from an attorney who represent CACH, LLC. who buy a debt from Bank of America because I owned them $3000. now went up to $9000
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Debt,Wage garnishment,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: Bank of America signed this account over to Cach LLC when you didn't pay. You are mistaken if you believe the creditor needs your permission to sell a debt and become legally able collect on it. Your choices with a wage garnishment are payment arrangements, settlement in a lump sum, or bankruptcy. Other more comical solutions are to change your identity by growing a mustache and leaving the country because you didn't like the outcome of an election. Hope this perspective helps!

Garnishments do not simply happen. Someone apparently has obtained judgment, writ of attachment. You should have opportunity to present your case. If you were not given proper notice you may file motion to set aside the judgment.
Immediately retain BK counsel to review facts and case file, assess, advise options, proceed with debt defense.
Depending on the length of time you have owed it, that's possible. You an challenge the garnishment within 10 days. Google "challenge wage garnishment."
